title: Techdirt Podcast Episode 379: Is the Internet Killing Culture? (No. Don’t Be Stupid.)
description: A couple weeks ago, we released the 2024 edition of our Sky Is Rising report about the state of the entertainment industries. title: Bluesky Opens Up

title: Fifth Circuit: Upon Further Review, Fuck The First Amendment
description: I’m not a religious man, but Jesus Fucking Christ. Yet another insane decision that allows the government to ignore constitutional rights has been handed down by the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals — the one nationally known as the most cop-friendly circuit in the nation. The long journey to this horrible ending begins in 2018. […]

title: Daily Deal: The Complete Cisco Training Bundle

title: Content Moderation At Scale Is Impossible To Do Well, Child Safety Edition
description: Last week, as you likely heard, the Senate had a big hearing on “child safety” where they grandstanded in front of a semi-random collection of tech CEOs, with zero interest in actually learning about the actual challenges of child safety online, or what the companies had done that worked, or where they might need help. title: FCC Takes Aim At AI Deepfake Robocalls After Sloppy Fake Biden Hoax
description: Last month you probably saw the story about how somebody used a (sloppy) deepfake of Joe Biden in a bid to try and trick voters into staying home during the Presidential Primary. It wasn’t particularly well done; nor was it clear it reached all that many people or had much of an actual impact. But […]

title: Cops Charge Teen With Murder After One Of Them Dies Shortly After Restraining Him
description: Cops will charge someone with assault, whether or not they’ve been actually assaulted. It’s a charge often added on top of resisting arrest and can be triggered by any movement or action that results in physical contact with an officer. Throwing a snowball in the direction of a cop can be considered assault, depending on […]
